arm_group.description: Individuals in this group have suffered a brain injury more than 2 years prior to study. Ages range from 35 to 70 (mean: 53.4).
This group of individuals have no history of brain injury. Ages range between 35 and 70 (mean: 53.9).

brief_summary.textblock:
Years after a suffering a brain injury, individuals remain in a physically and cognitively
      impaired state. The investigators  believe that the concentrations of amino acids in the
      blood are chronically altered and yield negative effects on the individuals health.
      Understanding these changes will help guide rehabilitative services for this population.
      Individuals with a chronic brain injury will donate samples of blood to be compared to that
      of non-injured individuals.

clinical_study.brief_title: Association of Amino Acid Prevalence and Chronic Brain Injury

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Willing to donate 10 ml of blood

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  (for brain injured group) have a chronic (greater than two years) traumatic brain
             injury.

          -  Unable to provide to give voluntary informed consent

study_pop.textblock:
Individuals in the chronic brain injured group are recruited from Tideway, a long-term
        care facility for individuals who have suffered a brain injury. The cohorts for this study
        will be recruited from the community in Galveston, Texas and the surrounding areas.

clinical_study.official_title: Association of Amino Acid Prevalence and Chronic Brain Injury

primary_outcome.description: 5 ml of blood will be acquired following a 8-hour fasting period to determine baseline concentrations of amino acids. A meal will then be provided and another blood sample will be acquired 90 minutes after completing the meal to examine the change in amino acid concentration. These samples will be used to determine the levels of each essential amino acid present.
primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of concentrations of essential amino acid at 1.5 hours after eating
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples taken following 8 hour fasting period and again 90 minutes after eating a predetermined meal

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The Transitional Learning Center, Galveston, TX

clinical_study.source: The Transitional Learning Center, Galveston, TX
clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
